# Summary

Describe the problem, what changed, and the expected impact.

## Type of Change

- [ ] `feat`: introduces a new feature or enhancement
- [ ] `fix`: bug fix or error correction
- [ ] `docs`: documentation update or addition
- [ ] `chore`: maintenance, cleanup, or non-functional changes
- [ ] `refactor`: code restructuring without behavior change
- [ ] `test`: adds or updates tests
- [ ] `ci`: changes to CI workflows or automation
- [ ] `build`: changes to build system or dependencies
- [ ] `perf`: performance improvement
- [ ] `style`: formatting or style-only changes (no logic change)
- [ ] `revert`: reverts a previous commit/change

## Target Branch

- [ ] This pull request targets the `dev` branch.

## Testing

- [ ] I added or updated automated tests for this PR.
- [ ] I did not add or update automated tests for this PR. Reason: `<required>`

List the commands you ran and the result for each (`pass`, `fail`, or `not run`).

- `command` -> `pass|fail|not run (reason)`

Examples:

- `npm run test:frontend` -> `pass`
- `npm run test` -> `not run (requires DEV environment)`
- `pytest -q` -> `pass`

## Changelog

Reference: <https://keepachangelog.com/en>

- [ ] I updated `CHANGELOG.md` for this PR.
- [ ] I did not update `CHANGELOG.md` for this PR. Reason: `<required>`

## Dependencies / Config Changes

Describe dependency, environment variable, config, or migration changes. Use `N/A` if none.

## Risk

State risks introduced by this change. Use `N/A` only for trivial docs-only changes.

Any additional context that helps reviewers.
